title: [Large-Scale] Sustainable Wastewater Treatment Practitioner Competency Enhancement Course: Realizing Social and Environmental Responsibility

context.prior_knowledge: Basic civil/environmental engineering knowledge, wastewater treatment system operation experience, and foundational understanding of Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs)
context.additional_context: Practice-oriented education for achieving SDG 6 (Clean Water and Sanitation) and SDG 4 (Lifelong Learning). Provides a blended learning environment combining VR-based simulations and forum discussions. Educational design considers social contexts such as community collaboration, civic education, and policy linkage.

learning_goals: Through VR simulations, learners will analyze key stages of wastewater treatment processes and identify over 80% of design errors considering scientific variables.
Propose at least 3 sustainable wastewater treatment strategies linked to SDG 6 and explain practical applications balancing community rights and environmental protection.
Derive field problem-solving solutions through knowledge sharing with peer practitioners via forum-based collaborative learning and propose citizen-participatory solution models.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
